definition: to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
flat/(coll.) to beat (sb) up/old variant of 匾[bian3]
to be cheated/to be taken in/to be hoodwinked
a swindle/a trap/a racket/a scam/CL:場|场[chang3]
to entice/to lure/to scam/to hoodwink/to decoy
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]

sentences.english: With only these few words, you can't intend to hocus me.
sentences.chinese: 就你这几句话甭打算把我骗了。

sentences.english: Cherry blossoms dont know, good for the chance to cheat the daughter said Mr Weng good a liar.
sentences.chinese: 樱花不认识帕良，翁因趁机骗女儿说帕良是骗子。

sentences.english: In addition, Customer must be clear-headed when someone wants to cheat you.
sentences.chinese: 此外，当有人要骗你的时候客户必须有着清醒的头脑。
她给人连哄带骗签了字。

sentences.english: She might be taken in by those quack doctors.
sentences.chinese: 她很可能会被那些庸医给骗了。

sentences.english: He deceived me by pretending to be a famous movie star.
sentences.chinese: 他假装成电影明星，骗了我。

sentences.english: Master, Don't trust that ape. The brother monkey is deliberately trying to trick you by magic way.
sentences.chinese: 师傅不要信那猴头，这是猴哥使的障眼法来骗您的。

sentences.english: They were the dupes of a clever but dishonest salesman.
sentences.chinese: 他们被一个聪明但不诚实的推销员骗了。

sentences.english: I have distrusted her ever since she cheated me.
sentences.chinese: 自从她骗我以后，我就不信任她了。

sentences.english: Ann: Honestly, there are so many beggars who are pretended to cheat the passerby.
sentences.chinese: 老实说，很多乞丐都是假装的，以此来骗路人的钱。

sentences.english: Scrub jays can trick you, researchers say.
sentences.chinese: 研究者发现，灌木丛里的鸟儿也能把你骗到。

sentences.english: She got over him in that way.
He deceived her by pretending to be a famous movie star.
sentences.chinese: 他冒充著名电影明星来骗她。

sentences.english: Don't trust that fellow, he'll if he gets the chance.
sentences.chinese: 不要相信那个家伙，他一有机会就回会骗你。

sentences.english: You don't want to sweet-talk me.
sentences.chinese: 你甭想花言巧语来骗我。

sentences.english: The poor child was cheated out of his inheritance by a dishonest lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 这个可怜的孩子被一个狡猾的律师骗去了遗产。

definition: to rock/to sway/to flicker (e.g. of lights reflected on water)/to flutter (e.g. of a flag)/to trick sb into doing sth/to dupe/to con
taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
to trick sb into having sex
